summaryText: Wow, what an incredible sermon from Pastor Travis Hearn about being stuck between the word and the world! Pastor Travis delivered a powerful message challenging believers to stop living with divided loyalties and fully commit to God's path. Drawing from the book of James, he passionately explained how trying to straddle both God's ways and worldly desires leads to an unsettled and unstable life. I love how he used the vivid monkey trap illustration - sometimes we're so attached to our 'fruit' that we can't let go, even when it's trapping us! The sermon was a wake-up call, reminding us that God is calling us UP, not just calling us OUT. Pastor Travis challenged us to surrender our will, take up our cross, and truly follow Jesus, even when it means cutting out things that are holding us back. His personal story about his mother's sacrificial love was particularly touching, showing how surrendering our will can look in real life. The core message? You can't experience God's favor while simultaneously feeding your flesh. It's time to soar like an eagle, not settle like a chicken in the coop!
mainPoints: Cut out things holding me back
Change my environment before my environment changes me

versesMentioned.text: Take up the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.

Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock. But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.

But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind. That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord. Such a person is double-minded and unstable in all they do.
No one can serve two masters. Either you will hate the one and love the other, or you will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.

But each person is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desire. Then desire when it has conceived gives birth to sin, and sin when it is fully grown brings forth death. Do not be deceived, my beloved brothers.
Then Jesus said to his disciples, 'Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.'
I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
Do not be misled: 'Bad company corrupts good character.'
But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things.

Monday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas of divided loyalty in my life
Monday.action: Create a personal inventory of your current life areas. Honestly assess where you might be trying to please both God and the world. Write down specific situations where you feel conflicted.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal to me the areas where I'm not fully surrendered. Give me the courage to see my divided loyalties clearly and the strength to choose You completely. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 4:7-8: 'Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. Come near to God and he will come near to you.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one specific area where you've been resisting full surrender. Take a practical step towards complete submission, whether it's letting go of a habit, relationship, or mindset.
Tuesday.prayer: God, I surrender this area to You. Help me resist the temptation to take control and trust in Your perfect plan. Give me the courage to let go and follow You completely. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.action: Make a list of past experiences or relationships that might be holding you back. Symbolically release these to God, perhaps by writing them down and then destroying the paper as an act of letting go.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me to press forward and not be anchored by my past. Give me the strength to move towards the future You have planned for me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Thursday.action: Review your current social circles and environments. Identify one relationship or setting that might be negatively influencing your spiritual growth and create a plan to either transform or distance yourself from it.
Thursday.prayer: God, give me wisdom in choosing my influences. Help me surround myself with people and environments that draw me closer to You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 10:5: 'We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.'
Friday.action: Practice mindfulness about your thought patterns. When a thought emerges that doesn't align with God's word, immediately replace it with a truth from Scripture.
Friday.prayer: Lord, help me capture and redirect my thoughts. Let my mind be transformed by Your truth and not the world's lies. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 86:11: 'Teach me your way, Lord, that I may rely on your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in prayer and reflection. Ask God to reveal any areas of your life where you're not fully committed and write down specific steps to realign your heart with His.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, create in me a pure and undivided heart. Help me to be fully committed to You in every area of my life. Reveal any hidden reservations and give me the courage to surrender completely. Amen.
